PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name: Robert J. Shaw
Address: 123 Main Street
Birthplace: South Dakota

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? March 20th, 1900
Where did you set up housekeeping? Smith, Manitoba
Where had you been living before that? South Dakota
For how many people did you prepare meals? 7
How far was it to your nearest store? 4 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a week
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, sugar, salt, soda, syrup, oatmeal, sugar, salt, soda,

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Hudson Bay (Homemade)
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.75 - $2.00
How much did you use graham flour? 10 lbs.
Whole wheat flour? 10 lbs.
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 17 miles
What year? 1900
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $1.75
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole Wheat? Yes
Farina? No
Other? No
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it? No

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

- **Yankee** - Boiled with salt, seasoned with pepper.
- **Yours** - Always salted.
- **Killed on our own land.**
- **Always** - Always served.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

- **1910** - Started.
- **1915** - Changed to canned foods from 1915.
- **1936** - Changed to preserved on the homestead.
